content.text: People often confuse misunderstanding with miscommunication. A misunderstanding comes from the receiver, who listens to the speaker because communication breaks, and the listener gets a different idea. In contrast, miscommunication comes the other way around. In this case, the person who wants to deliver a message doesn't communicate accurately. People from close-knit families have rivalry problems with their siblings, as they want to be the "favorite" son or daughter, and you can see this happening in family get-togethers, as they were not planned. Kids, or adults, must prepare to see the rest of the family. The larger the meeting, the more catastrophic it can get, as a furious mom always tries to fix all the problems between her offspring.
